articles.headline: U.S. Accuses Software Maker RealPage of Enabling Collusion on Rents
articles.snippet: The Justice Department filed an antitrust suit against the real estate software company, accusing it of creating an illegal pricing scheme to charge tenants more.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department filed an antitrust suit against the real estate software company, accusing it of creating an illegal pricing scheme to charge tenants more.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department filed an antitrust lawsuit on Friday against the real estate software company RealPage, saying its software enabled landlords to collude to raise rents across the United States.
articles.byline: By Danielle Kaye, Lauren Hirsch and David McCabe

articles.headline: Free Booze, a Lake Cruise and Selfies Galore: How Democrats Courted Influencers at the D.N.C.
articles.snippet: Democrats gave social media figures the V.I.P. treatment this week in an aggressive attempt to pump feeds with pro-Harris posts.
articles.abstract: Democrats gave social media figures the V.I.P. treatment this week in an aggressive attempt to pump feeds with pro-Harris posts.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last month, Kristin Brey, a podcaster, radio host and newspaper columnist, attended the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee as a credentialed journalist. She set up shop in a dank hockey arena, jostled in scrums with reporters for interviews and often could not get access to the floor of the convention hall because there was not enough space.
articles.byline: By Ken Bensinger and Todd Heisler

articles.headline: Harris Faces Challenge of Translating Convention Joy to Fall Momentum
articles.snippet: The newly anointed Democratic presidential nominee revived a demoralized party. But as she leaves Chicago, a bruising, closely fought contest awaits her.
articles.abstract: The newly anointed Democratic presidential nominee revived a demoralized party. But as she leaves Chicago, a bruising, closely fought contest awaits her.
articles.lead_paragraph: Joy cometh in the morning, but so do hangovers. The party in Chicago is done, the confetti has been swept up, the pictures have been posted to social media. But the real question as exuberant Democrats woke up on Friday was whether they could channel the sheer intoxication of the United Center into a sustained, 74-day sprint to Election Day.

articles.headline: Fed Chair Powell Signals ‘Time Has Come’ for September Rate Cut
articles.snippet: Jerome H. Powell made it clear that the Federal Reserve will cut rates on Sept. 18, as the central bank turns the corner in its fight against inflation.
articles.abstract: Jerome H. Powell made it clear that the Federal Reserve will cut rates on Sept. 18, as the central bank turns the corner in its fight against inflation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Speaking in his most closely watched speech of the year, Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, clearly signaled on Friday that the central bank was poised to cut interest rates in September.
